topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5548513d6368722656ca2a00#post_5548513d6368722656ca2a00
[bq="trashboat"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/554850c963687201ea930d00#post_554850c963687201ea930d00
You're missing my fucking point dude.

He isn't a good character solely because he's strong enough to beat anything in one punch. He's a good character Because he's a human being first and foremost. (He hates that absolutely nothing can give him a challenge anymore and that no one can understand just how he feels.)

For a comparison, Imagine *having* to turn god mode on in every video game you play ever, And you can't turn it off ever. That's his life.[/bq]
topics.author: 5062d6f17f123b3e16001184

topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5548513d6368722656ca2a00#post_5548513d6368722656ca2a00
[bq="trashboat"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/554850c963687201ea930d00#post_554850c963687201ea930d00
You're missing my fucking point dude.

He isn't a good character solely because he's strong enough to beat anything in one punch. He's a good character Because he reacts to it like a human being.[/bq]
. . . . Uhhh. . . Dude; have you ever heard of killers' regret?

The fact that he doesn't suffer from that makes he completely inhuman emotionally.

If you're wondering what that is the first time someone kills another human being be it war or such they get violently ill, like puking, shaking and shivering.  The fact he's never experienced that ever makes he the exact opposite of human.

And before you go "well <insert here>" even soldiers and people that go under training to kill experience killers' regret to some level.

Well you could post that instead of that short answer, silly.
I know that being ignored here feels bad, but saying that you are always ignored? No way, where did you get that?

"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/554853de6368720749230b00#post_554853de6368720749230b00
Basically, Saitama at the time was recently fired from his job as a salaryman, And saving the life of someone from a rampaging monster gave him a rush.

Also, That doesn't make any sense, If killing some of the most powerful monsters in existence gives him no thrill, Why would killing innocents suddenly give him that rush?

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/554850c963687201ea930d00#post_554850c963687201ea930d00
Well I have to say I like both kinds of characters.

I like Saitama cuz yeah he's strong, But, he hates it.

And technically he did work to get to where he is today but he didn't expect it to be like _this_. he wanted to be a Hero and fight bad guys and now after all his hard work he got what he wanted but has gained to much power to even be able to have an actual fight. meaning he has almost no fun!

Its like the road to get there was much more enjoyable to the road he is now on which is boring. 

And so Heroism is basically just a normal working day for him.

you wake up, eat breakfast, get ready for work, beat a bad guy, go to the grocery store, Ect. and the day is done.

And so you rest up till the next day to do the same thing. (That is if mole men don't decide to bust your wall don while you're sleeping that is)

And the thing about One punch man is that they do put in other character's that are strong but not as strong as Saitama to mix it up.

And some of these bad guys are not push overs themselves. and it turns out its a good thing Saitama is around because if he wasn't everyone would be fucking doomed. Yeah the S-Rank hero's can beat a lot of these assholes but the question is for how long? 

The monster's just keep getting stronger and stronger. Hell my favorite Arc "From Space" the bad guy kicked Saitama to the freaking moon.

Now imagine if that was someone else? Instant death.
